alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:27AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany and north central Jefferson Parishes, Harrison, Hancock and southeastern Pearl River Counties through 215 AM CST... At 127 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles east of Mcneil to near New Orleans. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Gulfport, Biloxi, Slidell, Long Beach, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Metairie, Diamondhead, East New Orleans, Chalmette, Pearl River, Lake Catherine, Kiln, Pearlington, Lyman, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center and Saucier. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 227 and 232, between mile markers 237 and 255, and between mile markers 259 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 37. Interstate 12 between mile markers 76 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Western Orleans
